intro: Silene integripetala subsp. integripetala, commonly known as the smooth-petaled catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals that are fused at the base. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in early summer.
